summary:
• FY26 operating profit guidance: $20.0 to $24.0 million.
  • Revenue target for FY27: $300 million.
  • R&D pipeline: Targets addressable markets worth over US$8 billion, with 8 patented products and 24 off-patent injectables in development.
  • Key commercialisation programs: Maxigesic®, Crystaderm®, Micolette®, Kiwisoothe®, and capsaicin cream.

No material capital markets or trading-specific actions identified (e.g., capital raising, trading halt).

• Revenue milestone: Achieved record sales of $208 million (first time exceeding $200 million).
  • Geographic expansion: Launched Maxigesic IV and Combogesic Rapid in the US; began sales of Maxigesic IV in Canada (addressable market >US$8 billion).
  • Financials: Net debt reduced to $14.5 million (from $16.2 million); dividend increased to 1.8 cents/share (from 1.6 cents).
  • R&D pipeline: 8 patented products in development, 24 off-patent injectables, and 5 programs nearing commercialization (e.g., Maxigesic variants, Crystaderm).
  • FY27 target: Ambitious $300 million revenue goal.

Note: No capital markets actions (e.g., raising, halt) or urgent trading signals identified.

Summary of AFT Pharmaceuticals 2025 Annual Shareholders' Meeting Announcement

Financial & Operational Highlights

  • FY25 Revenue: NZ$208.0M (6% YoY growth), with ANZ sales at NZ$180.9M.
  • FY27 Target: Revenue of NZ$300M.
  • Operating Profit: NZ$17.6M (down from NZ$24.2M in FY24 due to lower licensing income and strategic investments).
  • Dividend: Increased to 1.8 cents per share (from 1.6 cps in FY24).
  • Net Debt: NZ$14.5M (down from NZ$16.2M in FY24).
  • R&D Spend: NZ$15.0M (FY25), focused on 8 patented products and 24+ injectables.

Market Expansion & Strategy

  • Global Reach: Products sold in ~80 countries; distribution agreements in 100+ countries.
  • Key Markets: Growth in Australasia (NZ: NZ$53.8M; Australia: NZ$127.1M), hampered by disruptions in Asia (NZ$15.4M, down from NZ$19.3M).
  • New Hubs: Launches in EU, UK, USA, Canada, South Africa, Hong Kong, and Singapore, with pipelines of 17–40 products per region.

R&D Pipeline Highlights

  • Near-Term: 24 hospital injectables (filing 2025–2027), Migraine project (filing 1Q27), Pascomer (PWS treatment, filing 2027).
  • Long-Term: Antibiotic eye drop (2028), Keloid scar topical (2029), Burning Mouth Syndrome (2030).

Governance Resolutions

  1. Auditor remuneration approval (Deloitte).
  2. Re-election of Dr. Hartley Atkinson as Director.
  3. Election of Allison Yorston as Director.

Outlook

  • FY26 Operating Profit Guidance: NZ$20M–NZ$24M.
  • Focus on product launches, international growth, and R&D commercialization.

Omitted: Director names, boilerplate, historical background, and non-material operational details.
